intro: Achyronia venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive purple or reddish tint at the base. Achyronia venosa is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some areas.
